for_sales.sales_text:
"Joëlle" is a Yachting World 5 Tonner, built in 1947 at Philips Yard, Dartmouth. She was berthed at Poole YC for 22 years and previously at RNLI Depot, Poole. Owned by the same family for 52 years, four generations have sailed in her.

Maintained, re-rigged, re-engined, re-covered decks with Trakmark and converted from Bermudan sloop to cutter. She is in first class condition and was originally offered for sale at the end of the 1917 season. Four persons responded, with one spending several hours looking over the boat at her berth. Several days later "Joëlle" was laid up for the winter. No further realistic enquiries, so a major maintenance plan was set up, to achieve a first class `old’ yacht for the 2018 season: Hull and topsides, brightwork, mast and rigging, anchor and chain rode, together with electronics and interior paintwork have been tackled. All as listed in a full inventory listed below.

Please come to Poole YC to view her.

Inventory

Hull

1" larch on oak frames. Massive pitch pine stringers and beamshelves (4"x3") within. Hanging brackets etc. Re-galvanised 1997. Deck re-covered in 1990s (spare roll of Trakmark available). 2 main and ample 6’6" quarter berth, plus pipecot root berth. Shelving over and under-berth stowage good. Reasonable galley space and storage. Double burner paraffin stove.

Engine

18HP Perkins Perama M20, installed 2000. New Brig rubber dinghy and electric O/B, plus MOB Dan, light and horseshoe buoy. Six fenders, auto bilge pump, Whale and portable hand pump.
DSC VHF, Garmin chartplotter and handheld unit. Echo sounder and solar panel. Foghorn. Whale Pump.

Sails

Main, staysail and yankee. All terylene tan. More than adequate set of halyards, sheets and warps. Full set of International Code Signal Flags.

Paraffin gimballed saloon and anchor lights. Full internal 12v electric lighting and sockets. Electric anchor winch, S/L Sprint 600. 10 Kg S/L Delta anchor and 40 metres of new 7mm chain rode.
Spinnaker boom (+Ghosting Quadrilateral), 2 boat hooks (Al & Wood). 2 fire extinguishers. Spare lifejackets. Keel Bolts drawn and four replaced in 2007.

boat.full_description:
Originally built for a French dentist, 'Joëlle' has been in the same family for 54 years (1963 - 2017). Writing in 2017, her owner writes about his father and his own period of ownership:

Father carried out routine maintenace at Topsham for ten years, before I took over at Cowes and Poole. Father sailed the West Country, the Channel Isles and N. Brittany with his sons. He and I had one of the best sails I can remember, from the Dart to the Folly Inn on the Isle of Wight, where I took over maintenance with my wife and children. Father still sailed with us occasionally, to Chichester, Beaulieu and Poole. He also sailed with my brother and my Boss at BHC, to France.

Later in 1972, I joined the RNLI, and 'Joëlle' moved with us to Poole. Amongst other things we were able to drop the keel and replace keel bolts, totally re-deck with Trakmark and re-engine the Vedette with a Perkins Diesel.

As a family we sailed to Alderney, Guernsey and the South Coast. On the passage home we heard Concorde’s double ‘Bang’. One of the best family passages ever.
boat.name: Joëlle

ownerships.note: Built in 1947 for a French dentist, then owned by a Brigadier, before being taken over by the Welford family in 1963.
